content:
Kumar Eswaran claimed to have proof for RH (back in 2016) and an Indian expert commitee concluded after a year long open review process since February 2020 that the proof is correct. I just want to draw attention to this so maybe the Lean community is interested in starting to verify his works:
https://www.researchgate.net/project/Lectures-on-Kumar-Eswarans-proposed-proof-of-the-Riemann-Hypothesis
If I understand correctly, there is nothing to check here. The error is well-known and has been known for years.
It's not the job of the Lean community to attempt to verify this proof, it's the job of the people who believe the proof to be correct.
Yes, I read now something more about this and indeed it seems strange why the expert committee came to this conclusion.

I ended up reading about this this morning at https://skeptics.stackexchange.com/q/51965, which argues that the expert committee's review suffers from "an apparent lack of understanding of mathematical reasoning" which "[reduces] any credibility the committee might have had otherwise to zero".
